statement: When I was seven, I accidentally set the kitchen curtains on fire trying to make toast without a toaster.
In high school, I built a weather balloon that reached the edge of the stratosphere and sent back photos.
I once got lost in a foreign city for eight hours with no phone and ended up making a local friend who helped me find my hotel.
As a child, I believed I could talk to animals and kept a detailed journal of our 'conversations'.
One summer, I tried to learn how to skateboard and broke my arm on the very first day.
During my gap year, I volunteered at a wildlife rescue center and helped rehabilitate injured owls.
I once accidentally joined a wedding procession while hiking in the Himalayas and was fed a full meal by the bride’s family.
I spent one winter trying to learn how to knit and ended up making 13 lopsided scarves.
My first job was at a donut shop where I was terrible at frosting and got demoted to mopping floors.
I once mistook a famous actor for a waiter and only realized the mistake when my friend nearly fainted.
Growing up, I had a pet turtle named Mozart who escaped twice and was found both times in the neighbor’s garden.
I failed my driving test three times because I couldn’t parallel park under pressure.
I once spent two weeks learning sleight-of-hand magic and used it to impress my high school science teacher.
On a dare, I dyed my hair neon green in college and kept it that way for six months.
One time, I accidentally sent a love letter to my professor instead of my partner because I mixed up email tabs.
I got locked inside a museum bathroom overnight and had to call security to let me out at 3am.
When I was a kid, I wanted to become an astronaut and used to sleep in a homemade cardboard spaceship.
I once tried to cook Thanksgiving dinner by myself and ended up setting off three fire alarms.
During a road trip, I accidentally crossed an international border without realizing it and got politely escorted back.
I once trained a parrot to say 'Good morning' and it used to wake me up better than any alarm clock.
I joined a medieval reenactment group in college and spent every other weekend pretending to be a 14th-century baker.
I once got caught in a sudden snowstorm while camping and had to dig a snow cave to stay warm.
As a teenager, I learned how to juggle and once performed at my cousin’s birthday party.
I created a short comic series in high school that got published in the school paper for a whole semester.
One summer, I worked as a scare actor at a haunted house and scared someone so badly they dropped their phone.
I took a salsa class for a date and ended up being invited to join the amateur competition team.
I once spent 48 hours in a library during finals week and lived off vending machine snacks and coffee.
I taught myself Morse code as a hobby during lockdown and used it to send secret messages to my roommate.
As a child, I buried a 'time capsule' in our backyard and dug it up fifteen years later.
I once won a hot sauce eating contest and couldn’t taste anything properly for two days afterward.
In a college theatre production, I had to step in as the lead with only one hour of notice and no rehearsal.
I got chased by a goat while hiking in the countryside and had to climb a tree to escape.
I once wrote a poem that got published in a national anthology, but I submitted it under a fake name.
I adopted a dog on impulse after seeing it in a rainstorm, and it's been with me ever since.
I learned to unicycle during a summer job at a circus-themed café.
I tried to make my own cheese at home and ended up with something that smelled like gym socks.
I once fell asleep on a beach and woke up completely surrounded by a curious flock of seagulls.
During quarantine, I built a cardboard city in my living room for my cat, who ignored it completely.
I once mistook a live TV interview for a pre-recording and cursed on-air without realizing.
I entered a silent retreat for 10 days and accidentally laughed on day three.
I learned origami to impress a crush and ended up decorating my whole dorm room with paper cranes.
I once accidentally joined a marathon when I was out jogging and ran five kilometers before anyone noticed.
I baked a cake that exploded in the oven because I confused baking powder with yeast.
I once took a midnight swim in a lake and lost my swimsuit to a rogue wave.
My friend and I tried to build a raft out of soda bottles it sank instantly, but we were proud anyway.
I taught myself to play ukulele just to win a talent show — and came in second.
I ran for student council just to get out of gym class and somehow ended up president.
I got mistaken for a tour guide at a museum and gave an improvised (and mostly incorrect) tour to tourists.
I used to write fan fiction that became more popular than my real assignments in school.
I once got stuck in an elevator with a mime who insisted on staying in character the whole time.
